This is a very colorful FPS game. I liked the many options for defeating opponents, the story line was good, and was quite impressed with the ironic ending. I would recommend this game to players who are new to FPS games, or those who enjoy single player action games.

damn, they really did a great job with the AI

by AI I'm only talking about Elizabeth, the enemies in this game moves around brain dead with tons of bugs and glitches
What a roller coaster of emotions that was.

Its a good game with a different take on the series in an alternate america universe, though i still prefer the underwater settings of the first 2 games, something about being in the bottom of the ocean is more exciting to me than a floating city, the combat in this game is a bit limiting compared to previous games where u could use all weapons and spells at any time, but its definitely worth checking out
This game is my favorite game of all time, and I'm just now playing it for myself (previously I had watched my father play it and then a playthrough). I cannot recommend it enough.
Gameplay become more limited than in previous games but storytelling still strong

hot take, but this is, in my opinion, the second best bioshock game. The first is still a little better, and 2 is fantastic, but infinite was breathtaking. Teared up at many points, combat and gameplay was amazing, and the story was a treat. A must play, along with the rest of the series.

Great game, my first ever BioShock game but... what the fuck is going on??? I do not understand the ending at all. Everything seemed to went downhill nearing the end of the game and it is so confusing. I'm not really good in understanding "multiverses" so this story is not for me. Though I gotta say, the story is very interesting at first, all you gotta do is just bring this girl named Elizabeth to Paris because she wanted to see Paris in person. Story aside... this is probably the most fun action first person shooter game I've ever played, not only you can use an already existing plethora of guns, you can also use this power you'll obtain from these salt bottles scattered around Columbia. Elizabeth is probably the best companion to ever existed, she'll give you ammos, salts, and money when you're low on them which is very useful because you'll shoot and buy a lot, like A LOT of things in this game. Overall, this game is a 7/10 at the very best.

I will always love this game, Story and gameplay are on point imo. Elizabeth is my favorite companion from any game and I'm a huge Zelda fan. Dlc is also fantastic where you get to play as her (Burial At Sea pt2). Clash in the clouds is also highly underrated and serves as a brutal challenge for those achievement hunters out there! 
Play time on here doesn't reflect actual playtime, I've 100% on xbox 360, loved it then and still do!

es divertido y de mundo abierto podes atacar conseguir armas pelear contra jefes etc, bueno es rrrree re contra reeee divertido recomendado para compus gamers no para compus portatiles o de escritorio
Great story and DLC, sadly it loses a lot of the gameplay from previous titles but it is still fun and great for people new to the franchise, though the first game is a much better place to start.

great single player game, but still raged while playing the game
Love the story and the look/feel of this game.  Big fan of the Bioshock franchise and this one is just fun to play over and over again.
The game that lives up to the name Bioshock to it . You know what I mean if you have played the original Bioshock
In VR mit VorpX der Hammer. Empfehle den immersive Screen Modus!

Convoluted plot that makes no sense if you stop and think at all. Upgrades for guns you cant use because you run out of ammo and can only hold 2 guns. Vigors that almost all overlap in ability with no placement into the story like the original Bioshock had. The exploration is toned down from the original. The big daddy fights were better than the handyman fights in infinite. The original allowed you to prepare for the fight and take on the battle in your own way or not at all. All the choices in the game meant nothing and just slowed the pace of the experience.
Beautiful game, really captures and defines steampunk aviation type worlds. Existensial crisis ahoy.
